intro: Zosterophyllanthos cedrinorum, commonly known as the Cedrinum zosterophyll, is a rare and specialized plant found in specific tropical wetlands. It belongs to the order Zosterophyllales, which is characterized by its unique morphological features resembling both algae and early land plants. The plant exhibits a complex structure with a central stem and branching filaments, which are believed to have evolved for efficient nutrient absorption in aquatic environments. Its reproductive structures are highly adapted for dispersal via water, contributing to its limited geographic distribution. Despite its ecological significance, Zosterophyllanthos cedrinorum remains poorly studied due to its elusive habitat and conservation status.
